An **axe** is a type of [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a one-handed [melee](/wiki/Melee "Melee") weapon that is made of [iron](/wiki/Iron "Iron"), and can be [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown") without a [to-hit](/wiki/To-hit "To-hit") penalty. An axe can also be [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied") to chop down [doors](/wiki/Door "Door") or [trees](/wiki/Tree "Tree").

[Eating](/wiki/Eating "Eating") a non-blessed [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") while wielding an axe will use the weapon to open it in six turns at most.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Generation

[Barbarians](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian") have a 1⁄2 chance of starting the game with an axe as their secondary weapon.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

Axes make up about 4% of randomly generated weapons (on the floor, as [death drops](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop"), or in [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop")). In addition to random generation, weapon [shops](/wiki/Shop "Shop") and general stores can stock axes.

[Ninja](/wiki/Ninja "Ninja") have a 1⁄4 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") an axe.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Live [dwarves](/wiki/Dwarf_\(monster_attribute\) "Dwarf (monster attribute)") that are generated with a [dwarvish short sword](/wiki/Dwarvish_short_sword "Dwarvish short sword") have a 1⁄4 chance of generating with an axe.[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Axe skill

| Axe     |                                                                                                                                         |
| ------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max     | [Role](/wiki/Role "Role")                                                                                                               |
| Basic   | - [Tourist](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist")                                                                                                    |
| Skilled | * [Caveman](/wiki/Caveman "Caveman"), [Knight](/wiki/Knight "Knight"), [Ranger](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger"), [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") |
| Expert  | - [Barbarian](/wiki/Barbarian "Barbarian"), [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie")                                                       |

Both the axe and the [battle-axe](/wiki/Battle-axe "Battle-axe") use the **axe** [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill"). [Cleaver](/wiki/Cleaver "Cleaver") is an [artifact weapon](/wiki/Artifact_weapon "Artifact weapon") battle-axe.

Axe-type weapons deal +d4 damage versus [wood golems](/wiki/Wood_golem "Wood golem").[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) Any axe-type weapon can be [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied") to chop in a specified direction, attacking a monster in that direction or chopping through a [door](/wiki/Door "Door") or a [tree](/wiki/Tree "Tree") - the process of chopping with an axe is similar to [digging](/wiki/Dig "Dig") with a [pick-axe](/wiki/Pick-axe "Pick-axe") or [dwarvish mattock](/wiki/Dwarvish_mattock "Dwarvish mattock"), and [tunneling monsters](/wiki/Tunneling_monster "Tunneling monster") can do the same if they possess an axe.

Felling a tree with an axe has a 1⁄5 chance of generating a fruit [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible"), independent of the odds of [kicking](/wiki/Kick "Kick") fruit from a tree.[\[6\]](#cite_note-6) Attempting to chop through a shop door will produce a message and cause you to abort the attempt, though by constantly resuming you will eventually succeed and potentially anger the shopkeeper.[\[7\]](#cite_note-7) Applying an axe to chop into a [statue](/wiki/Statue "Statue") will produce a unique message and may cause up to 2 points of damage.

## Strategy

An axe is an unremarkable weapon in terms of damage, but is very useful as a means of breaking through locked doors, especially if you lack an [unlocking tool](/wiki/Unlocking_tool "Unlocking tool").

Applying an axe to a door is a safer way to break one than kicking, since it cannot immediately destroy shop doors and incur a 400-[zorkmid](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") bill for damages - the message indicating that you are chopping a shop's door is slightly misleading, but will generally display enough that a player can catch on before it is too late. Do *not* attempt to chop through any doors and trees in view of a [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown") [watchman](/wiki/Watchman "Watchman"), or you will instantly anger them.

## History

The axe first appears in Hack121 and Hack for PDP-11, which are both based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), and it is included in the initial item list for [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0").

## Messages

- This door seems too hard to chop through.

  You attempted to apply an axe-type weapon to a shop door.

- Halt, vandal! You're under arrest!

  A watchman saw you chop into a tree or door with an axe-type weapon.

* Sparks fly as you whack the statue.

  You attempted to apply an axe-type weapon to a statue.

* The axe-handle vibrates violently!

  You took some damage from the above attempt.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [upgrading](/wiki/Upgrading "Upgrading") an axe will produce a battle-axe and vice versa.

An axe appears in the left center courtyard of the [Yeoman quest](/wiki/Yeoman_quest "Yeoman quest") locate level.

[Giantkiller](/wiki/Giantkiller "Giantkiller") is an [artifact](/wiki/Artifact "Artifact") axe that replaces [Giantslayer](/wiki/Giantslayer "Giantslayer") from *NetHack*.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the peaceful [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem") generated in the forest within the [Ruins of Moria](/wiki/Ruins_of_Moria "Ruins of Moria") is always generated with an axe.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack") add the [diskos](/index.php?title=Diskos\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Diskos (page does not exist)") and [moon axe](/index.php?title=Moon_axe\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Moon axe (page does not exist)") as weapons that use the axe skill, and all axes deal an extra d4 damage to [plants](/wiki/Plant_\(dNetHack\) "Plant (dNetHack)") and wooden enemies. The diskos uses the higher between a character's axe and [polearms](/wiki/Polearms "Polearms") skills for damage if they are not twoweaponing or using a shield, and will otherwise default to axe skill if either is applicable.

Carrying [The Air Crystal](/wiki/The_Air_Crystal "The Air Crystal") raises skill in axes by one level. [Marionette, Puppet of Screams](/wiki/Spirits_\(dNetHack\)#Marionette.2C_Puppet_of_Screams "Spirits (dNetHack)") is a spirit that grants skill in axes while bound.

Giantslayer's [base item](/wiki/Base_item "Base item") is changed to an axe, and [The Rod of Lordly Might](/wiki/The_Rod_of_Lordly_Might "The Rod of Lordly Might") and [The Sceptre of Lolth](/wiki/DNetHack_artifacts#The_Sceptre_of_Lolth "DNetHack artifacts") can be [invoked](/wiki/Invoke "Invoke") to take on the form of an appropriate axe.

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") introduces the [throwing axe](/wiki/Throwing_axe "Throwing axe") as a weapon that uses the axe skill and can be [multishot](/wiki/Multishot "Multishot") when thrown.

At a [furnace](/wiki/Furnace "Furnace"), two axes can be combined to create a battle-axe, and an axe can be combined with a pick-axe to create a dwarvish mattock.

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds the [dwarvish bearded axe](/wiki/Dwarvish_bearded_axe "Dwarvish bearded axe") as a weapon that uses the axe skill.

An axe is always generated on the first floor of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm") and the third floor of [Vecna's Domain](/wiki/Vecna%27s_Domain "Vecna's Domain") at level creation.

An axe can be created at a [forge](/wiki/Forge_\(dungeon_feature\) "Forge (dungeon feature)") by combining a [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger") and a [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear"). Axes can be used to create a few items:

- An axe can be combined with a dwarvish short sword to create a dwarvish bearded axe.
- An axe can be combined with a [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword") to create a battle-axe.
- An axe can be combined with a [ranseur](/wiki/Ranseur "Ranseur") to create a [halberd](/wiki/Halberd "Halberd").
- An axe can be combined with a spear to create a [voulge](/wiki/Voulge "Voulge").

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, dwarven characters in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") can reach a minimum of Skilled in axes.

[Frostbite](/index.php?title=Frostbite\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Frostbite (page does not exist)") is an artifact weapon that uses the axe skill.

### Hack'EM

[Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") adds the dwarvish bearded axe from EvilHack and the throwing axe from SpliceHack.

An axe can be upgraded to a throwing axe, and vice versa. In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, axes can be used in two other recipes:

- An axe can be combined with a dagger to create a throwing axe.
- Two axes can be combined to create a battle-axe.

## Encyclopedia entry

"For ev'ry silver ringing blow,  
Cities and palaces shall grow!"  
  
"Bite deep and wide, O Axe, the tree,  
Tell wider prophecies to me."  
  
"When rust hath gnaw'd me deep and red,  
A nation strong shall lift his head.  
  
"His crown the very Heav'ns shall smite,  
Aeons shall build him in his might."  
  
"Bite deep and wide, O Axe, the tree;  
Bright Seer, help on thy prophecy!"

\[ Malcolm's Katie, by Isabella Valancey Crawford ]

[[SpliceHack]] introduces the [[throwing axe]] as a weapon that uses the axe skill and can be [[multishot]] when thrown.

At a [[furnace]], two axes can be combined to create a battle-axe, and an axe can be combined with a pick-axe to create a dwarvish mattock.

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds the [[dwarvish bearded axe]] as a weapon that uses the axe skill.

An axe is always generated on the first floor of the [[Ice Queen's Realm]] and the third floor of [[Vecna's Domain]] at level creation.

An axe can be created at a [[Forge (dungeon feature)|forge]] by combining a [[dagger]] and a [[spear]]. Axes can be used to create a few items:

* An axe can be combined with a dwarvish short sword to create a dwarvish bearded axe.
* An axe can be combined with a [[broadsword]] to create a battle-axe.
* An axe can be combined with a [[ranseur]] to create a [[halberd]].
* An axe can be combined with a spear to create a [[voulge]].

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, dwarven characters in [[SlashTHEM]] can reach a minimum of Skilled in axes.

[[Frostbite]] is an artifact weapon that uses the axe skill.

===Hack'EM===
[[Hack'EM]] adds the dwarvish bearded axe from EvilHack and the throwing axe from SpliceHack.

An axe can be upgraded to a throwing axe, and vice versa. In addition to EvilHack forging recipes, axes can be used in two other recipes:

* An axe can be combined with a dagger to create a throwing axe.
* Two axes can be combined to create a battle-axe.
